H0.text: how many co2 molecules are produced in aerobic respiration. 4

H1.text: how many co2 molecules are produced in aerobic respiration. 8

H2.text: how many co2 molecules are produced in aerobic respiration. 2

H3.text: how many co2 molecules are produced in aerobic respiration. 6

A4.text: Products of the first turn of the cycle are one GTP (or ATP), three NADH, one FADH2 and two CO2.

A5.text: Therefore, at the end of two cycles, the products are: two GTP, six NADH, two FADH2, and four CO2.

A6.text: The reaction may be simplified as: Pyruvate + NAD+ + CoA â†’ Acetyl-CoA + NADH + CO2.

A7.text: The pyruvate dehydrogenase complex (PDC) catalyzes the decarboxylation of pyruvate, resulting in the synthesis of acetyl-CoA, CO2, and NADH.
